key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to climate change, geopolitical instability, and fluctuating commodity prices
Intense competitive pressures from established coffee brands and private-label manufacturers
Challenges in scaling sustainability efforts across the global supply chain
Uncertain public market performance and ability to meet investor expectations
controversies: Potential scrutiny over the company's ability to meet its sustainability goals effectively
Declining sales and fluctuating margins post-SPAC merger
environmental_issues: Climate change impacts on coffee-producing regions
Need to reduce carbon emissions and improve water usage efficiency
social_issues: Ensuring fair labor practices and equitable supply chains
Supporting farmer education and profitability in coffee-growing regions
governance_issues: Transparency and credibility in sustainability reporting
Management of funds raised through SPAC merger and delayed draw term loan

sources.title: Raíz Sustainability™ | Our Inclusive Sustainable Solutions
sources.snippet: Raíz was created by Westrock Coffee to root farm profitability, sustainable agriculture, fair labor practices, and equitable supply chains. sources.title: Raíz Sustainability® | Our Inclusive Sustainable Solutions - Westrock ...
sources.snippet: A farmer's journey in sustainable solutions through Raíz Sustainability ® begins with their commitment to uphold the Raíz standard, which establishes mandatory requirements for farmers and Westrock Coffee's supply partners in four key areas: social, environmental, economic, and traceability.
